e4: My recommendation to refrain from immediately switching to a no-bias-reporting policy stems from the possibility of unforeseen market repercussions. First, a sudden shift may appear as a signal of decreased financial health, potentially impacting investor confidence and stock price. This is compounded because even if investors are expecting a bias adjustment, it requires significant market clarity and acceptance to facilitate a seamless transition.}
e5: An ethical reporting policy for a company should prioritize honesty and transparency. It ensures investors have accurate information to make informed decisions, even in the face of potential economic challenges or market fluctuations. A key element is providing consistent explanations of its methods for earnings projection to foster trust with stakeholders. Balancing the need for profitable short-term strategies with long-term integrity would further contribute to an ethical and sustainable business model.
e6: Yes. I would like to understand how the company plans to communicate any potential market impact and address concerns or questions that may arise from investor communities regarding transparency and fairness in reporting.
